comments.raw_text:
A patch that changes configure in a way that can cause many tests to change needs a clobber.

An example is at https://tbpl.mozilla.org/?tree=Mozilla-Inbound&rev=4fce3a720570 where a change to the compiler flags invalidated the configure cache.

comments.raw_text: So, I gave this some thoughts since yesterday, and we actually don't need to flush config.cache every time we update configure. The problem is with tests with a result that can change depending on CFLAGS/CXXFLAGS/LDFLAGS. There aren't a lot of these, but the few that do will fail. So the "easy" solution is to make these tests non cached.
